leaf_cluster.leaf_cluster_name: 科研知识图谱-实体规范化与证据链生态
leaf_cluster.task_chain: 抽取→对齐→融合→推理→版本→评测

queries: [WEB] grounding llm with knowledge graph github

tools.name: PapersChat
tools.one_line_profile: Agentic AI tool for querying and analyzing scientific papers from ArXiv and PubMed
tools.detailed_description: An agentic AI application designed to assist researchers in literature review and information extraction. It allows users to chat with their local papers and automatically retrieves and incorporates information from scientific databases like ArXiv and PubMed, facilitating evidence-based research.

tools.name: Pyhaystack
tools.one_line_profile: Python library to connect to Project Haystack for building science data
tools.detailed_description: A module that allows Python programs to connect to a Haystack server (Project Haystack), facilitating the retrieval and management of semantic data from building automation systems (Niagara, Skyspark, etc.) for energy and operational research.

tools.name: GraphRAG Workbench
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive visualization tool for Microsoft GraphRAG knowledge graphs
tools.detailed_description: A visual analytics workbench designed to explore entities, relationships, and communities within knowledge graphs generated by Microsoft GraphRAG, aiding in the interpretation and debugging of RAG-based evidence chains.

tools.name: Rankify
tools.one_line_profile: Comprehensive benchmarking toolkit for retrieval and RAG
tools.detailed_description: A Python toolkit integrating multiple pre-retrieved benchmark datasets, retrieval techniques, and re-ranking models to evaluate and optimize Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines for scientific and general information retrieval tasks.

tools.name: XRAG
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmarking framework for RAG component modules
tools.detailed_description: A framework dedicated to examining and benchmarking the core component modules of Advanced Retrieval-Augmented Generation systems, enabling researchers to evaluate the performance of different RAG strategies.

tools.name: GraphRAG SDK
tools.one_line_profile: SDK for building GraphRAG applications with FalkorDB
tools.detailed_description: A software development kit designed to facilitate the creation of Graph Retrieval-Augmented Generation (GraphRAG) applications, leveraging knowledge graphs to enhance LLM reasoning and evidence retrieval.

tools.name: paper-qa
tools.one_line_profile: High-accuracy RAG agent for answering questions from scientific documents with citations
tools.detailed_description: A library that uses Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) to answer questions from scientific literature (PDFs/text) with verifiable citations. It manages document parsing, embedding, and answer generation with evidence grounding.

tools.name: FacTool
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for detecting factual errors in generative AI outputs
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed to detect factuality in texts generated by Large Language Models. It supports various domains including knowledge-based QA and scientific code generation, helping to verify the reliability of AI-generated content.

tools.name: FEAT
tools.one_line_profile: Factcheck Explorer Analysis Tool for visualizing fact-checking data
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed to facilitate the exploration, analysis, and visualization of fact-checking data, aiding researchers in understanding misinformation trends and evidence chains.

tools.name: Simba
tools.one_line_profile: Portable Knowledge Management System for RAG integration
tools.detailed_description: A knowledge management system designed to integrate with Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) systems. It handles parsing, chunking, and indexing of documents to support evidence-based retrieval tasks.

tools.name: GraphRAG-Benchmark
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark suite for evaluating GraphRAG models
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive benchmark and dataset toolkit for evaluating Graph-based Retrieval-Augmented Generation models, providing metrics and evaluation pipelines for knowledge-intensive tasks.

tools.name: LightRAG
tools.one_line_profile: Simple and fast Retrieval-Augmented Generation framework
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight and efficient framework for building Retrieval-Augmented Generation systems. It optimizes the retrieval and generation pipeline for speed and simplicity, suitable for building scientific knowledge assistants.

tools.name: AutoSchemaKG
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for automatic knowledge graph construction and schema generation
tools.detailed_description: A tool for automatically constructing knowledge graphs that combines schema generation via conceptualization. It helps in structuring unstructured scientific data into organized knowledge graphs.

tools.name: CRUD-RAG
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark for evaluating RAG systems on CRUD capabilities
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive benchmark suite for evaluating Retrieval-Augmented Generation systems, specifically focusing on Create, Read, Update, and Delete operations in knowledge retrieval contexts.

tools.name: Prophecies
tools.one_line_profile: Self-hosted data validation platform for fact checking
tools.detailed_description: A platform designed for labor-intensive fact-checking and data validation. It allows users to verify claims against evidence, managing the workflow of investigative journalism and scientific verification.

tools.name: Medical-Graph-RAG
tools.one_line_profile: Graph RAG System for Evidence-based Medical Information Retrieval
tools.detailed_description: A specialized RAG system that utilizes knowledge graphs to enhance medical information retrieval. It focuses on providing evidence-based answers for medical queries by grounding generation in structured medical knowledge.

tools.name: RAG-FiT
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for fine-tuning LLMs for RAG tasks
tools.detailed_description: A framework designed to enhance Large Language Models for Retrieval-Augmented Generation tasks through fine-tuning. It provides tools to optimize LLMs for better context utilization and answer generation.

tools.name: MeDuSA
tools.one_line_profile: Fine-resolution cellular deconvolution method for bulk RNA-seq
tools.detailed_description: A bioinformatics tool that leverages scRNA-seq data as a reference to estimate cell-state abundance in bulk RNA-seq data with high resolution.

tools.name: Entity-Linking
tools.one_line_profile: Named Entity Recognition and Linking tool for mapping text entities to knowledge bases
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation for Entity Linking, which identifies named entities in text and maps them to unique entities in a specific knowledge base. It includes modules for Named Entity Recognition (NER) and disambiguation.

tools.name: RasterSmith
tools.one_line_profile: Preprocessing tool for NASA Earth observing satellite data products
tools.detailed_description: A package to preprocess different NASA Earth observing satellite data products into common resolution, spatial reference, and format for easy analysis and processing across sensors.

tools.name: LettuceDetect
tools.one_line_profile: Hallucination detection framework for RAG applications
tools.detailed_description: A framework designed to detect hallucinations in Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) applications, enhancing the reliability and trustworthiness of generated content.

tools.name: xmc.dspy
tools.one_line_profile: In-Context Learning library for eXtreme Multi-Label Classification (XMC)
tools.detailed_description: A tool leveraging DSPy for In-Context Learning to perform eXtreme Multi-Label Classification (XMC) using only a handful of examples.

tools.name: VAP
tools.one_line_profile: Visual noise generation for mitigating object hallucinations in LVMs
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of 'Poison as Cure', using visual noise to mitigate object hallucinations in Large Vision-Language Models (LVMs).

tools.name: LeanRAG
tools.one_line_profile: Knowledge-Graph-Based Generation with Semantic Aggregation
tools.detailed_description: A framework for Knowledge-Graph-Based Generation that utilizes semantic aggregation and hierarchical retrieval to enhance RAG performance.

tools.name: RAKG
tools.one_line_profile: Document-level Retrieval Augmented Knowledge Graph Construction
tools.detailed_description: A tool for constructing Knowledge Graphs using document-level retrieval augmentation, facilitating better structured knowledge extraction from texts.

tools.name: Graph-R1
tools.one_line_profile: Agentic GraphRAG Framework via End-to-end Reinforcement Learning
tools.detailed_description: A framework implementing Agentic GraphRAG using end-to-end reinforcement learning to optimize retrieval and generation processes over graph structures.

tools.name: HyperGraphRAG
tools.one_line_profile: Retrieval-Augmented Generation via Hypergraph-Structured Knowledge Representation
tools.detailed_description: Official implementation of HyperGraphRAG, utilizing hypergraph-structured knowledge representations to enhance retrieval-augmented generation capabilities.

tools.name: Platform War Public
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-agent debate simulation framework using GraphRAG
tools.detailed_description: A chatbot/GraphRAG framework that creates multi-llm-agents from social platform user comments to simulate debates on specific topics, useful for social science simulation and analysis.

tools.name: AGLA
tools.one_line_profile: Mitigating Object Hallucinations in Large Vision-Language Models
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of Assembly of Global and Local Attention (AGLA) to mitigate object hallucinations in Large Vision-Language Models (LVLMs).

tools.name: MiniCheck
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient Fact-Checking tool for LLMs on Grounding Documents
tools.detailed_description: A tool for efficient fact-checking of Large Language Models (LLMs) against grounding documents, ensuring the accuracy and reliability of generated text.

tools.name: spacyfishing
tools.one_line_profile: spaCy wrapper for Entity-Fishing named entity disambiguation
tools.detailed_description: A spaCy wrapper component for Entity-Fishing, enabling named entity disambiguation and linking to Wikidata within spaCy pipelines.

tools.name: context-cite
tools.one_line_profile: Attribution tool for citing LLM generated statements to in-context information
tools.detailed_description: A tool to attribute or cite statements generated by Large Language Models (LLMs) back to the source information provided in the context, enhancing interpretability and grounding.

tools.name: AutoRAG
tools.one_line_profile: AutoML-style framework for RAG evaluation and optimization
tools.detailed_description: An open-source framework for Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) evaluation and optimization, automating the process of finding the best RAG pipeline configurations.

tools.name: SciQAG
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for generating science question-answer pairs from literature
tools.detailed_description: A framework for automatically generating high-quality science question-answer pairs from a large corpus of scientific literature using large language models, useful for dataset creation and training.

tools.name: go-light-rag
tools.one_line_profile: Go implementation of LightRAG for graph-based retrieval
tools.detailed_description: A Go library implementation of LightRAG, a Retrieval-Augmented Generation system that combines vector databases with graph database relationships for enhanced knowledge retrieval.

tools.name: HSA-DPO
tools.one_line_profile: Hallucination detection and mitigation in LVLMs via fine-grained AI feedback
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of HSA-DPO, a method for detecting and mitigating hallucinations in Large Vision-Language Models (LVLMs) using fine-grained AI feedback.

tools.name: context-aware-rag
tools.one_line_profile: Library for Knowledge Graph ingestion and retrieval in RAG
tools.detailed_description: A Context-Aware RAG library designed for Knowledge Graph ingestion and retrieval functions, facilitating the integration of structured knowledge into RAG pipelines.

tools.name: GraphragTest
tools.one_line_profile: Utility to enable GraphRAG with non-OpenAI models (Ollama, etc.)
tools.detailed_description: A solution/wrapper that allows the use of the GraphRAG framework with local and other non-GPT large models (like Ollama, Qwen, etc.), facilitating broader access to GraphRAG capabilities.

tools.name: Controllable-RAG-Agent
tools.one_line_profile: Advanced RAG solution for complex QA using graph-based algorithms
tools.detailed_description: An advanced Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) solution designed for complex question answering, utilizing sophisticated graph-based algorithms to handle intricate queries.

tools.name: HippoRAG
tools.one_line_profile: Neurobiologically inspired RAG framework for long-term knowledge integration
tools.detailed_description: A novel Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) framework inspired by human long-term memory (hippocampal indexing theory). It enables Large Language Models (LLMs) to continuously integrate knowledge across external documents using Knowledge Graphs and Personalized PageRank, specifically addressing the challenge of multi-hop reasoning and knowledge integration in scientific and general domains.

tools.name: RagView
tools.one_line_profile: Unified evaluation platform for RAG methods on custom datasets
tools.detailed_description: A unified evaluation platform designed to benchmark different Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) methods on user-specific data. It addresses the limitation that SOTA results are often dataset-dependent, providing a tool for researchers to evaluate and select the best RAG strategies for their specific scientific or domain knowledge bases.

tools.name: Falcon 2.0
tools.one_line_profile: Joint entity and relation linking tool over Wikidata
tools.detailed_description: A rule-based tool for joint entity and relation linking over Wikidata. It performs fundamental tasks for Knowledge Graph construction and grounding by mapping textual mentions to Wikidata entities and relations, essential for scientific knowledge extraction and normalization.

tools.name: ReLiK
tools.one_line_profile: Fast and accurate entity linking and relation extraction retriever
tools.detailed_description: Retrieve, Read and LinK (ReLiK) is a fast and accurate system for Entity Linking (EL) and Relation Extraction (RE). It uses a dense retriever architecture to link text mentions to knowledge graph entities and relations, optimized for efficiency on academic budgets. It serves as a critical component for grounding scientific text to structured knowledge.

tools.name: R2R
tools.one_line_profile: Production-ready agentic RAG system for scientific knowledge retrieval
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive, production-ready Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) system developed by SciPhi-AI. It provides a RESTful API for agentic retrieval, designed to make Large Language Models (LLMs) accessible and grounded for scientific applications. It supports complex ingestion, retrieval, and generation pipelines suitable for scientific knowledge bases.

tools.name: EmoLLM
tools.one_line_profile: Comprehensive LLM framework for mental health counseling and analysis
tools.detailed_description: A specialized Large Language Model framework for mental health, supporting pre-training, post-training, evaluation, and RAG. It serves as a scientific modeling tool for psychology and mental health research, enabling the development of AI agents for counseling and patient analysis.

tools.name: LongCite
tools.one_line_profile: Tool enabling LLMs to generate fine-grained citations for evidence-based QA
tools.detailed_description: A framework designed to enhance Large Language Models with the ability to generate precise, sentence-level citations in long-context question answering. This directly supports the 'Evidence Chain' requirement in scientific RAG systems by ensuring generated claims are grounded in source texts.

tools.name: Equi7Grid
tools.one_line_profile: Spatial reference system library for high-resolution global raster data
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of the Equi7Grid spatial reference system, optimized for handling global high-resolution raster data in Earth observation and remote sensing. It facilitates scientific data processing by providing a consistent grid system for geospatial analysis.

tools.name: bbw
tools.one_line_profile: Library for linking CSV data to Wikibase instances
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed for entity linking, typing, and relation extraction by matching CSV data to Wikibase instances (like Wikidata). It supports the construction and normalization of scientific knowledge graphs by aligning tabular data with established knowledge bases.

tools.name: spacyopentapioca
tools.one_line_profile: SpaCy wrapper for OpenTapioca entity linking on Wikidata
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline component for spaCy that integrates OpenTapioca for named entity linking against Wikidata. This tool facilitates the normalization of entities in scientific text processing by linking mentions to unique identifiers in a large-scale knowledge graph.

tools.name: Cyber Huatuo (cyber-doctor)
tools.one_line_profile: Medical agent framework based on LLM and Knowledge Graph
tools.detailed_description: A multimodal agent framework ('Cyber Huatuo') that integrates Large Language Models with medical knowledge graphs and databases. It functions as a scientific inference tool for medical diagnosis, case analysis, and professional QA, facilitating the deployment of AI in healthcare research and application.

tools.name: G-Retriever
tools.one_line_profile: Graph-based Retrieval-Augmented Generation solver for textual graph understanding
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of the G-Retriever method for Retrieval-Augmented Generation on textual graphs. It serves as a solver for questioning and answering over graph-structured data, enabling scientific inference on complex relational datasets (e.g., knowledge graphs).

tools.name: singleCellHaystack
tools.one_line_profile: Method for finding differentially active genes in single-cell transcriptome data
tools.detailed_description: A package that uses Kullback-Leibler divergence to find genes with non-random spatial distributions in single-cell transcriptomics data, enabling the discovery of biologically significant markers without relying on clustering.

tools.name: nel
tools.one_line_profile: Entity linking framework for connecting text mentions to knowledge base entities
tools.detailed_description: A framework for Named Entity Linking (NEL) that facilitates the grounding of textual entities into knowledge graphs, essential for constructing evidence chains.

tools.name: ApeRAG
tools.one_line_profile: Production-ready GraphRAG system with multi-modal indexing
tools.detailed_description: A scalable Graph Retrieval-Augmented Generation (GraphRAG) system designed for production environments, supporting multi-modal indexing and agentic workflows for knowledge retrieval.

tools.name: math-llm
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for grounding LLM mathematical reasoning with proof assistants
tools.detailed_description: A tool that interfaces Large Language Models with formal proof assistants to verify and ground mathematical reasoning, ensuring logical consistency in scientific inference.

tools.name: graphrag-rs
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance Rust implementation of GraphRAG
tools.detailed_description: A Rust-based implementation of Graph Retrieval-Augmented Generation that builds knowledge graphs from documents for efficient natural language querying and entity extraction.

tools.name: graphrag-toolkit
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for building graph-enhanced GenAI applications
tools.detailed_description: A Python toolkit designed to facilitate the construction and deployment of GraphRAG applications, integrating knowledge graphs with generative AI for enhanced evidence retrieval.

tools.name: geomodelgrids
tools.one_line_profile: Library for geographic referenced grid-based earth models
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library for handling geographic referenced grid-based models composed of blocks with different grid resolutions, used in geological and geophysical modeling.

tools.name: BEIR
tools.one_line_profile: Heterogeneous benchmark for information retrieval evaluation
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive benchmark suite for evaluating information retrieval models across diverse datasets, essential for validating RAG and evidence retrieval systems.

tools.name: cragg
tools.one_line_profile: Statistical test for weak IV instruments in R
tools.detailed_description: An R package implementing the Cragg-Donald test for weak instruments in instrumental variable regression, a specific statistical analysis tool.

tools.name: TypeTruth
tools.one_line_profile: Library for detecting AI-generated text
tools.detailed_description: A tool to detect whether text is written by a human or AI, serving as a quality control mechanism for scientific content and evidence verification.

tools.name: VeritasGraph
tools.one_line_profile: Enterprise-grade Graph RAG for verifiable attribution
tools.detailed_description: A Graph RAG system focused on secure, on-premise AI with verifiable attribution, ensuring evidence chains are traceable and grounded.

tools.name: BABILong
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark for long-context LLM evaluation
tools.detailed_description: A benchmark designed to evaluate Large Language Models' ability to retrieve information from long contexts (needle-in-a-haystack), critical for assessing RAG capabilities.

tools.name: SapBERT
tools.one_line_profile: Self-alignment pretraining for biomedical entity linking
tools.detailed_description: A model and toolkit for biomedical entity linking (BEL) that aligns representations of entities, facilitating the normalization of biomedical concepts in knowledge graphs.

tools.name: DATSR
tools.one_line_profile: Reference-based Image Super-Resolution with Deformable Attention Transformer
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of reference-based image super-resolution using deformable attention transformers, applicable for enhancing scientific imaging data.

tools.name: LogicRAG
tools.one_line_profile: Logic-enhanced Retrieval-Augmented Generation
tools.detailed_description: A RAG framework that incorporates logical reasoning capabilities to improve the accuracy and reliability of generated answers, suitable for complex scientific query answering.

tools.name: dspy-neo4j-knowledge-graph
tools.one_line_profile: Automated knowledge graph construction using DSPy and Neo4j
tools.detailed_description: A tool that leverages DSPy and Neo4j to automate the construction of knowledge graphs from text, facilitating the creation of structured evidence bases.

tools.name: fast-graphrag
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient and adaptive GraphRAG framework
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance GraphRAG system that intelligently adapts to data and queries, optimizing the retrieval and generation process for knowledge-intensive tasks.

tools.name: clef2018-factchecking
tools.one_line_profile: Evaluation resources for automated fact checking
tools.detailed_description: A collection of data, format checkers, and scoring scripts for the CLEF2018 Fact Checking Lab, used for benchmarking fact-checking and evidence verification systems.

tools.name: GNN-RAG
tools.one_line_profile: Graph Neural Retrieval for Large Language Modeling Reasoning
tools.detailed_description: A library implementing GNN-RAG, a method that combines Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) with Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) to enhance the reasoning capabilities of Large Language Models (LLMs) over Knowledge Graphs.

tools.name: TagMe
tools.one_line_profile: Entity Linking system implementation
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of the TagMe entity linking system, designed to identify meaningful substrings (spots) in an unstructured text and link them to pertinent Wikipedia pages.

tools.name: PBOH Entity Linking
tools.one_line_profile: Probabilistic Bag-Of-Hyperlinks Model for Entity Linking
tools.detailed_description: Source code for the Probabilistic Bag-Of-Hyperlinks (PBOH) model, a method for entity linking that leverages hyperlink information to disambiguate entities in text.

tools.name: Databricks Auto Data Linkage
tools.one_line_profile: Automated entity resolution solution for data linkage
tools.detailed_description: A solution accelerator for automated entity resolution and data linkage, providing tools for intra- and inter-data linking and de-duplication within a lakehouse environment.

tools.name: DBpedia Lookup
tools.one_line_profile: Entity retrieval service for DBpedia
tools.detailed_description: A generic entity retrieval service for linked data, specifically designed to replicate the DBpedia Lookup service, allowing for searching and resolving DBpedia URIs from keywords.

tools.name: Haystack
tools.one_line_profile: Orchestration framework for RAG and semantic search
tools.detailed_description: An open-source NLP framework for building search systems that work intelligently with large collections of documents. It provides the core components for Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), Question Answering, and Semantic Search pipelines.

tools.name: Dexter
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for entity linking algorithms
tools.detailed_description: A framework that implements popular entity linking algorithms and provides tools to develop, evaluate, and benchmark new entity linking techniques.

tools.name: BLP
tools.one_line_profile: Inductive Entity Representations from Text via Link Prediction
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of a method for learning inductive entity representations from text by optimizing a link prediction objective, enabling entity linking and knowledge graph completion tasks.

tools.name: MultiVerS
tools.one_line_profile: Model and checkpoints for scientific claim verification against evidence
tools.detailed_description: A system designed to predict the veracity of scientific claims by retrieving and reasoning over relevant evidence from scientific literature. It supports fact-checking and evidence-based verification tasks.

tools.name: spaCy-entity-linker
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for linking text entities to Wikidata knowledge graph
tools.detailed_description: A spaCy pipeline extension that performs entity linking to Wikidata. It resolves named entities in text to their corresponding unique identifiers in the knowledge graph, facilitating entity normalization and grounding.

tools.name: CRAG
tools.one_line_profile: De novo characterization of cell-free DNA fragmentation hotspots
tools.detailed_description: A bioinformatics tool for analyzing cell-free DNA (cfDNA) fragmentation patterns. It identifies fragmentation hotspots which are crucial for understanding chromatin structure and gene regulation in liquid biopsy data.

tools.name: cragr
tools.one_line_profile: R package for CRAG (Cell-free DNA fragmentation analysis)
tools.detailed_description: The R implementation/package for the CRAG algorithm, facilitating the analysis of cell-free DNA fragmentation hotspots within the R statistical environment.

tools.name: CooRnet
tools.one_line_profile: Detection of coordinated link sharing behavior on social media
tools.detailed_description: An R package for computational social science that detects coordinated link sharing behavior (CLSB) on social media platforms. It outputs networks of entities performing such behavior, useful for analyzing information diffusion and manipulation.

tools.name: BLINK
tools.one_line_profile: State-of-the-art entity linking library using bi-encoders and cross-encoders
tools.detailed_description: A scalable entity linking python library that uses a two-stage approach (bi-encoder for retrieval, cross-encoder for re-ranking) to link entities in text to a knowledge base (Wikipedia). Essential for entity normalization in scientific KGs.

tools.name: RAG Arena
tools.one_line_profile: Evaluation platform for Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) systems
tools.detailed_description: An open-source platform for evaluating RAG pipelines through user feedback and comparative analysis. It serves as a tool for quality control and benchmarking of scientific information retrieval and generation systems.

tools.name: Graphiti
tools.one_line_profile: Library for building dynamic, real-time knowledge graphs for AI agents
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed to create and manage temporal knowledge graphs. It allows for the ingestion of unstructured data to build structured, graph-based memory for agents, supporting entity and relation extraction and dynamic updates.

tools.name: RAGEval
tools.one_line_profile: Evaluation toolkit for Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) methods
tools.detailed_description: A library providing metrics and tools to evaluate the performance of RAG systems. It helps in assessing retrieval accuracy, generation quality, and faithfulness, which are critical for scientific evidence chains.

tools.name: LangExtract
tools.one_line_profile: Library for extracting structured information with source grounding using LLMs
tools.detailed_description: A tool for information extraction that emphasizes precise source grounding. It converts unstructured text into structured data while maintaining links to the original evidence, supporting the creation of verifiable knowledge bases.

tools.name: Berkeley Entity Resolution System
tools.one_line_profile: Joint entity resolution system for NER, coreference, and linking
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive system for entity resolution that jointly models named entity recognition, coreference resolution, and entity linking. It is a foundational tool for transforming raw text into normalized entities.

tools.name: nano-graphrag
tools.one_line_profile: A lightweight and hackable implementation of GraphRAG for retrieval-augmented generation
tools.detailed_description: A simplified, easy-to-understand implementation of GraphRAG (Graph Retrieval-Augmented Generation) designed for experimentation and customization in knowledge graph-enhanced LLM workflows.

tools.name: TRACE
tools.one_line_profile: Temporal Grounding Video LLM via Casual Event Modeling
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of the TRACE model for temporal grounding in videos, capable of localizing events in video content using Large Language Models.

tools.name: VTG-LLM
tools.one_line_profile: Video LLM integrating timestamp knowledge for enhanced temporal grounding
tools.detailed_description: A Video Large Language Model framework that integrates timestamp knowledge to improve performance in video temporal grounding tasks.

tools.name: ERVSR
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient Reference-based Video Super-Resolution model
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of the ERVSR model for enhancing video resolution using reference frames, applicable in video processing and enhancement tasks.

tools.name: dspy-redteam
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for red-teaming Language Models using DSPy
tools.detailed_description: A tool for evaluating and red-teaming Large Language Models to identify vulnerabilities and robustness issues, leveraging the DSPy framework.

tools.name: EntityLinkingRetrieval-ELR
tools.one_line_profile: Entity linking integration for enhanced entity retrieval
tools.detailed_description: A library/framework for exploiting entity linking within search queries to improve entity retrieval performance, relevant for knowledge graph and information retrieval tasks.

tools.name: TAGME-Reproducibility
tools.one_line_profile: Reproducible implementation of the TAGME entity linking system
tools.detailed_description: Provides code to reproduce and use the TAGME entity linking system, a tool for annotating text with hyperlinks to Wikipedia pages.

tools.name: ComfyUI_LLM_Party
tools.one_line_profile: ComfyUI nodes for LLM Agents and RAG workflows
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive set of nodes for ComfyUI that integrates various LLMs, Agents, and RAG capabilities (including GraphRAG), enabling the construction of complex AI research and processing workflows.

tools.name: HiRAG
tools.one_line_profile: Retrieval-Augmented Generation with Hierarchical Knowledge
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of HiRAG, a method for RAG that leverages hierarchical knowledge structures to improve generation quality.

tools.name: Activation_Decoding
tools.one_line_profile: Hallucination mitigation via inner representation analysis
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of 'In-Context Sharpness as Alerts', a method to detect and mitigate hallucinations in LLMs by analyzing inner activation representations.

tools.name: LRAGE
tools.one_line_profile: Evaluation framework for Legal RAG pipelines
tools.detailed_description: A specialized framework for evaluating Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines within the legal domain, providing metrics and tools for assessment.

tools.name: ComfyUI-IF_AI_tools
tools.one_line_profile: ComfyUI nodes for local LLM integration via Ollama
tools.detailed_description: A set of custom nodes for ComfyUI enabling the integration of local Large Language Models (via Ollama) into image generation and AI workflows.

tools.name: ViDoRe Benchmark
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark for Vision Document Retrieval
tools.detailed_description: Evaluation code and benchmark suite for Vision Document Retrieval (ViDoRe), supporting the assessment of models like ColPali.

tools.name: RAGFlow
tools.one_line_profile: Open-source RAG engine with agent capabilities
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) engine that combines RAG with agentic capabilities to build context-aware LLM applications.

tools.name: REL
tools.one_line_profile: Radboud Entity Linker
tools.detailed_description: A modular and efficient entity linking library (Radboud Entity Linker) capable of linking text mentions to knowledge base entities.

tools.name: IPEX-LLM
tools.one_line_profile: LLM acceleration library for Intel XPU
tools.detailed_description: A library for accelerating local LLM inference and fine-tuning on Intel hardware (CPUs, GPUs, NPUs), integrating with popular frameworks like LangChain and LlamaIndex.

tools.name: OntologyRAG
tools.one_line_profile: Biomedical code mapping using RAG and Ontologies
tools.detailed_description: A tool leveraging Retrieval-Augmented Generation and Ontology Knowledge Graphs to improve biomedical code mapping and normalization.

tools.name: Bitcoin-Transaction-Network-Extraction
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to extract Bitcoin transaction networks from binary data
tools.detailed_description: Processes raw Bitcoin binary data into flat file formats suitable for network analysis and scientific research on transaction graphs.

tools.name: RagRank
tools.one_line_profile: Evaluation toolkit for RAG applications
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit for assessing the accuracy, context understanding, and quality of Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) systems.

tools.name: ScientificDiscourseTagging
tools.one_line_profile: Scientific discourse tagging for evidence extraction
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of a sequence tagging model designed to identify discourse roles in scientific text, aiding in evidence extraction and literature analysis.

tools.name: fact-checker
tools.one_line_profile: LLM output fact-checking using self-ask
tools.detailed_description: A tool/implementation for verifying the factual accuracy of Large Language Model outputs using the self-ask prompting technique.

tools.name: audio_dspy
tools.one_line_profile: Python package for audio signal processing
tools.detailed_description: A library providing various digital signal processing tools and filters specifically for audio analysis and synthesis.

tools.name: GraphRAG-Bench
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark for Graph Retrieval-Augmented Generation
tools.detailed_description: A benchmarking suite designed to evaluate the reasoning capabilities of GraphRAG systems in domain-specific contexts.

tools.name: llm-eval
tools.one_line_profile: Evaluation platform for Large Language Models and RAG systems
tools.detailed_description: A platform for evaluating Large Language Models (LLMs) supporting multiple benchmarks, custom datasets, and performance testing. It specifically includes support for evaluating Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) systems based on custom datasets.

tools.name: autoarena
tools.one_line_profile: Automated head-to-head evaluation library for LLMs and RAG systems
tools.detailed_description: A library designed to rank Large Language Models (LLMs), RAG systems, and prompts using automated head-to-head evaluation mechanisms, facilitating comparative analysis of model performance.

tools.name: DSRs
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance Rust implementation of the DSPy framework
tools.detailed_description: A performance-centered rewrite of the DSPy framework in Rust, designed to optimize the programming and orchestration of language models for scientific and general AI tasks.

tools.name: langchain-graphrag
tools.one_line_profile: LangChain implementation of GraphRAG for query-focused summarization
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of the GraphRAG approach (From Local to Global) compatible with LangChain, enabling graph-based retrieval-augmented generation for tasks like query-focused summarization.

tools.name: global-canopy-height-model
tools.one_line_profile: High-resolution global canopy height estimation model
tools.detailed_description: A model developed to estimate canopy top height anywhere on Earth at high resolution using Sentinel-2 imagery, trained with sparse GEDI LIDAR data as reference. Useful for ecological and environmental research.

tools.name: langstruct
tools.one_line_profile: Library for extracting structured data using LLMs
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed to extract structured data from unstructured content using Large Language Models, facilitating data processing and knowledge base construction tasks.

tools.name: Citation-Graph-Python
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for generating citation graphs from reference data
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool for automatically generating citation graphs from references, aiding in bibliometric analysis and visualization of scientific literature connections.

tools.name: paperqa-zotero
tools.one_line_profile: LLM-based question answering tool for Zotero libraries
tools.detailed_description: A tool that integrates Large Language Models with Zotero to enable question answering based on the content of PDF documents in a user's reference library, supporting literature review and evidence retrieval.

tools.name: mulrel-nel
tools.one_line_profile: Named Entity Linking system with latent relations
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of a Named Entity Linking (NEL) model that utilizes latent relations to improve entity disambiguation, a key task in knowledge graph construction and text normalization.

tools.name: StrainScan
tools.one_line_profile: High-resolution strain-level microbiome composition analysis tool
tools.detailed_description: A bioinformatics tool for high-resolution strain-level microbiome composition analysis based on reference genomes and k-mers, enabling precise identification of microbial strains.

tools.name: litegraph
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight graph database for AI knowledge persistence
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight graph database supporting relational, vector, and MCP features, designed to power knowledge persistence and retrieval for artificial intelligence applications.

tools.name: fid-med-eval
tools.one_line_profile: Feature extraction and evaluation metrics for generative medical imaging
tools.detailed_description: A Python library implementing Feature Extraction for Generative Medical Imaging Evaluation, specifically designed to provide evidence against evolving trends in medical image synthesis assessment. It offers metrics like FID tailored for medical datasets.

tools.name: RadFact
tools.one_line_profile: Metric suite for evaluating radiology report generation and grounding
tools.detailed_description: A metric suite leveraging the logical inference capabilities of LLMs to evaluate radiology report generation, focusing on factual correctness and grounding in medical evidence.

tools.name: GraphRAG
tools.one_line_profile: Modular graph-based Retrieval-Augmented Generation system
tools.detailed_description: A graph-based Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) system designed to extract structured data from unstructured text, build knowledge graphs, and support complex reasoning over private data. It is a key infrastructure for scientific literature mining and evidence chain construction.

tools.name: phenomics-assistant
tools.one_line_profile: LLM RAG agent for the Monarch Knowledge Graph
tools.detailed_description: A retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) agent specifically designed to interact with the Monarch Knowledge Graph, enabling researchers to query and retrieve phenomic and genomic evidence.

tools.name: Pubmed-PaperQA
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for searching, downloading, and QA on PubMed papers
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit for building question-answering language models based on scientific literature from PubMed. It includes functionality for searching and downloading papers, facilitating evidence-based QA.

tools.name: LLM Graph Builder
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to construct knowledge graphs from unstructured data using LLMs
tools.detailed_description: A Neo4j Labs tool that utilizes Large Language Models to extract nodes and relationships from unstructured text data and construct a Neo4j knowledge graph, facilitating the conversion of text into structured knowledge.

tools.name: Neo4j GraphRAG Python
tools.one_line_profile: Official Python client for Neo4j GraphRAG implementation
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed to facilitate Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) using Neo4j knowledge graphs. It provides tools for retrieving context from graph structures to enhance LLM responses.

tools.name: Vocalocator
tools.one_line_profile: Deep neural networks for sound source localization and vocalization attribution
tools.detailed_description: A scientific analysis tool developed by NeuroStats Lab for localizing sound sources and attributing vocalizations, specifically designed for neuroscience and bioacoustics research.

tools.name: Xapian Haystack
tools.one_line_profile: Xapian backend integration for the Haystack NLP framework
tools.detailed_description: A library extension that provides a Xapian backend for Haystack, enabling efficient information retrieval and document storage for RAG and QA pipelines in scientific knowledge management.

tools.name: GraphRAG Visualizer
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization tool for Microsoft GraphRAG artifacts
tools.detailed_description: A web-based tool designed to visualize and explore the artifacts generated by Microsoft's GraphRAG, aiding researchers in understanding the structure and content of the generated knowledge graphs.

tools.name: WFGY
tools.one_line_profile: Semantic Reasoning Engine for LLMs to mitigate RAG hallucinations
tools.detailed_description: A semantic reasoning engine designed to fix RAG and OCR drift, collapse, and ghost matches via symbolic overlays and logic patches, aiming to improve the reliability of scientific information retrieval.

tools.name: OpeNER Coreference Base
tools.one_line_profile: Coreference resolution tool for English language
tools.detailed_description: A component of the OpeNER project providing coreference resolution capabilities, essential for entity normalization and evidence linking in scientific text processing.

tools.name: Open Movement
tools.one_line_profile: Firmware and software for Open Movement sensor devices
tools.detailed_description: Open source firmware and software for Open Movement miniature sensors, used for scientific data generation in movement analysis and health research.

tools.name: Open Semantic Entity Search API
tools.one_line_profile: REST API for named entity extraction and linking
tools.detailed_description: An open source REST API tool for named entity extraction, linking, disambiguation, and reconciliation, facilitating the semantic tagging of documents against knowledge graphs.

tools.name: Open Semantic ETL
tools.one_line_profile: ETL tools for document processing and semantic analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based ETL toolkit for file crawling, text extraction, OCR, and content analysis (NER), designed to ingest data into Solr/Elasticsearch or graph databases for semantic search applications.

tools.name: Open Semantic Visual Graph Explorer
tools.one_line_profile: Visual explorer for linked data graphs
tools.detailed_description: A web-based visualization tool for exploring direct and indirect connections between named entities in a knowledge graph, supporting discovery and analysis of semantic relationships.

tools.name: OpenTapioca
tools.one_line_profile: Real-time entity linking system for Wikidata
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight entity linking system that works with Wikidata, capable of adapting to real-time edits, used for normalizing entities in text to Wikidata identifiers.

tools.name: Hoaxy Backend
tools.one_line_profile: Backend for Hoaxy misinformation visualization tool
tools.detailed_description: The backend component for Hoaxy, a scientific tool developed by Indiana University to visualize the spread of claims and fact-checking in social networks.

tools.name: ALCE
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark and toolkit for evaluating LLM citation generation and evidence grounding
tools.detailed_description: A framework for enabling and evaluating Large Language Models in generating text with correct citations, addressing the hallucination and evidence alignment problem in scientific text generation.

tools.name: rag-citation
tools.one_line_profile: Library for adding citation and reference tracking to RAG pipelines
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight tool designed to enhance Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) by automatically generating and managing citations for AI-generated content, ensuring evidence alignment.

tools.name: Llama-Researcher
tools.one_line_profile: Autonomous research agent for comprehensive online literature review
tools.detailed_description: A research assistant tool built on LlamaIndex that performs autonomous online research, synthesizing information from multiple sources to generate comprehensive reports, useful for scientific literature review.

tools.name: OpenCE
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for implementing and evaluating LLM context engineering strategies
tools.detailed_description: OpenCE (Open Context Engineering) is a community toolkit designed to implement, evaluate, and combine various LLM context strategies such as RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation), ACE, and context compression. It aids in optimizing the evidence chain for scientific QA and reasoning.

tools.name: semanticizer
tools.one_line_profile: Entity linking tool for mapping text mentions to knowledge base entities
tools.detailed_description: Semanticizer is a Python tool for entity linking, designed to identify and link entities in text to a knowledge base. It supports the entity normalization process essential for constructing scientific knowledge graphs.

tools.name: STaRK
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark suite for LLM retrieval on textual and relational knowledge bases
tools.detailed_description: STaRK is a benchmarking framework designed to evaluate Large Language Model (LLM) retrieval capabilities across textual and relational knowledge bases. It provides datasets and evaluation scripts to measure the effectiveness of RAG systems in handling structured and unstructured knowledge.

tools.name: ARES
tools.one_line_profile: Automated evaluation framework for RAG systems
tools.detailed_description: ARES (Automated RAG Evaluation System) is a tool for evaluating Retrieval-Augmented Generation systems. It uses synthetic data and LLM-based judges to assess context relevance, answer faithfulness, and answer relevance, helping to optimize RAG pipelines for scientific knowledge.

tools.name: STORM
tools.one_line_profile: LLM-powered knowledge curation and report generation system
tools.detailed_description: STORM is a knowledge curation system that orchestrates LLMs to research topics, retrieve information from the web or knowledge bases, and generate comprehensive reports with citations. It automates the evidence gathering and synthesis process for scientific literature review.

tools.name: DSPy
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for programming and optimizing language model pipelines
tools.detailed_description: DSPy is a framework for algorithmically optimizing LM prompts and weights. It allows researchers to build complex RAG and information extraction pipelines by programming logical flows rather than manual prompt engineering, essential for robust scientific knowledge extraction.

tools.name: RAG Genie
tools.one_line_profile: Prototype tool for evaluating RAG embeddings and chunking strategies
tools.detailed_description: RAG Genie is a tool designed to test and evaluate different embedding models and chunk splitting strategies within a RAG pipeline. It helps researchers optimize retrieval performance for specific document sets.

tools.name: LLM Structured Output Benchmarks
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark suite for LLM structured output frameworks
tools.detailed_description: This repository provides benchmarks for various LLM structured output frameworks (like Instructor, Outlines, etc.) on tasks such as Named Entity Recognition (NER) and classification. It aids in selecting the best tools for extracting structured scientific data from text.

tools.name: RAGLite
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight toolkit for RAG with DuckDB and PostgreSQL
tools.detailed_description: RAGLite is a Python toolkit that simplifies the implementation of Retrieval-Augmented Generation systems using DuckDB or PostgreSQL. It provides a lightweight infrastructure for building local scientific knowledge retrieval systems.

tools.name: MedType
tools.one_line_profile: Medical entity linking tool with semantic type prediction
tools.detailed_description: MedType is a tool for medical entity linking that leverages semantic type prediction to improve disambiguation accuracy. It is specifically designed for mapping medical mentions in text to knowledge base entities.

tools.name: AutoCitation
tools.one_line_profile: LLM agent for finding and verifying citations
tools.detailed_description: AutoCitation is an LLM-based agent designed to find real citations for content. It assists in the evidence chain process by verifying claims and retrieving authentic academic references.

tools.name: Trinity-IE
tools.one_line_profile: Information extraction pipeline for coreference resolution, entity linking, and relationship extraction
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive information extraction pipeline designed to process text and extract structured knowledge. It integrates coreference resolution, named entity linking, and relationship extraction into a unified workflow, facilitating the construction of knowledge graphs from unstructured text.

tools.name: Cognee
tools.one_line_profile: Deterministic graph generation and memory management library for AI agents
tools.detailed_description: A library that implements deterministic graph generation (GraphRAG) and memory management for AI systems. It structures unstructured data into knowledge graphs to provide grounded context and reduce hallucinations in retrieval-augmented generation tasks.

tools.name: ROGRAG
tools.one_line_profile: Robustly Optimized GraphRAG Framework for enhanced retrieval-augmented generation
tools.detailed_description: A framework designed to optimize GraphRAG (Graph Retrieval-Augmented Generation) workflows. It provides tools for constructing and querying knowledge graphs to improve the robustness and accuracy of LLM responses in scientific and general domains.

tools.name: TrustGraph
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for generating knowledge graphs to eliminate AI hallucinations
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed to generate knowledge graphs from data to ground AI agents and eliminate hallucinations. It focuses on creating trustworthy evidence chains for LLMs by leveraging structured graph data.

tools.name: NameMatch
tools.one_line_profile: Probabilistic entity linkage tool for record matching
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool for probabilistically linking records of individual entities within and across datasets. It is essential for entity normalization and cleaning in scientific data pipelines.

tools.name: RLTK
tools.one_line_profile: Record Linkage ToolKit for entity resolution and linking
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive Record Linkage ToolKit (RLTK) designed for finding and linking entities across heterogeneous datasets. It provides a suite of algorithms for blocking, matching, and resolving entities, supporting knowledge graph construction.

tools.name: LearningByReading
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline of NLP and Entity Linking tools for knowledge extraction
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline of Natural Language Processing and Entity Linking tools implemented in C. It is designed for 'Learning by Reading' tasks, extracting entities and knowledge from text for scientific or general knowledge base construction.

tools.name: Open-RAG-Eval
tools.one_line_profile: RAG evaluation tool without requiring golden answers
tools.detailed_description: A tool for evaluating Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) systems without the need for ground truth 'golden answers'. It uses LLM-based metrics to assess the quality of retrieved context and generated responses, essential for validating evidence chains.

tools.name: Ragas
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for evaluating Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive framework for evaluating RAG pipelines. It provides metrics for faithfulness, answer relevance, and context retrieval quality, enabling quantitative assessment of evidence chains and generation quality in scientific AI applications.

tools.name: Time-R1
tools.one_line_profile: R1-like Video-LLM for temporal grounding in videos
tools.detailed_description: A video large language model designed for temporal grounding, enabling the alignment of textual queries with specific video segments, relevant for multimodal evidence grounding.

tools.name: wikientities
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for linking entities in CommonCrawl to Wikipedia concepts
tools.detailed_description: A Java-based tool designed to perform entity linking on large-scale datasets like CommonCrawl, mapping text mentions to Wikipedia concepts for knowledge graph construction.

tools.name: CCA-LLaVA
tools.one_line_profile: Mitigating object hallucination in LVLMs via Concentric Causal Attention
tools.detailed_description: A method and implementation for reducing object hallucinations in Large Vision-Language Models using Concentric Causal Attention, enhancing the trustworthiness of multimodal generation.

tools.name: FEL
tools.one_line_profile: Fast Entity Linker Toolkit for linking entities to Knowledge Bases
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit for training and deploying models to link entities in documents and queries to a Knowledge Base (specifically Wikipedia), facilitating entity normalization.

tools.name: ConVis
tools.one_line_profile: Contrastive Decoding with Hallucination Visualization for MLLMs
tools.detailed_description: A tool implementing contrastive decoding strategies and visualization techniques to mitigate and analyze hallucinations in Multimodal Large Language Models.

tools.name: HawkEye
tools.one_line_profile: Training Video-Text LLMs for Grounding Text in Videos
tools.detailed_description: An implementation for training Video-Text Large Language Models specifically to ground textual descriptions in video content, supporting multimodal evidence alignment.

tools.name: Eider
tools.one_line_profile: Document-level Relation Extraction with Efficient Evidence Extraction
tools.detailed_description: A tool for document-level relation extraction that emphasizes efficient evidence extraction and inference-stage fusion, aiding in knowledge graph construction from text.

tools.name: SRTK
tools.one_line_profile: Subgraph Retrieval Toolkit for large-scale knowledge graphs
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit designed to retrieve semantically relevant subgraphs from large-scale knowledge graphs, supporting RAG and knowledge-enhanced inference.

tools.name: less-is-more
tools.one_line_profile: Mitigating Multimodal Hallucination via EOS Decision
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of a decoding strategy to mitigate multimodal hallucination in Large Vision-Language Models by focusing on End-of-Sentence (EOS) decisions.

tools.name: Factcheck-GPT
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for fact-checking LLM outputs with annotation and evaluation
tools.detailed_description: A framework for fact-checking the outputs of generative Large Language Models, providing tools for both annotation and automated evaluation of factual accuracy.

tools.name: ESCNet
tools.one_line_profile: Entity-enhanced and Stance Checking Network for Multi-modal Fact-Checking
tools.detailed_description: A network implementation for multi-modal fact-checking that leverages entity information and stance detection to verify claims against evidence.

tools.name: DeGF
tools.one_line_profile: Self-Correcting Decoding with Generative Feedback for Hallucination Mitigation
tools.detailed_description: A decoding framework that uses generative feedback to self-correct and mitigate hallucinations in Large Vision-Language Models.

tools.name: SIFT
tools.one_line_profile: Grounding LLM Reasoning in Contexts via Stickers
tools.detailed_description: A tool for grounding Large Language Model reasoning in specific contexts, enhancing the reliability and evidence-alignment of model outputs.

tools.name: OPA-DPO
tools.one_line_profile: Mitigating Hallucinations in LVLMs via On-Policy DPO
tools.detailed_description: A Direct Preference Optimization (DPO) based approach to mitigate hallucinations in Large Vision-Language Models by utilizing on-policy data.

tools.name: ONLY
tools.one_line_profile: One-Layer Intervention for Hallucination Mitigation in LVLMs
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight intervention method that targets a single layer to effectively mitigate hallucinations in Large Vision-Language Models.

tools.name: Self_Reflection_Medical
tools.one_line_profile: Mitigating LLM Hallucination via Self Reflection in Medical Domain
tools.detailed_description: A framework for mitigating hallucinations in Large Language Models specifically within the medical domain using self-reflection mechanisms.

tools.name: REVERIE
tools.one_line_profile: Reflective Instruction Tuning for Mitigating Hallucinations in LVLMs
tools.detailed_description: An instruction tuning approach that incorporates reflection to reduce hallucinations in Large Vision-Language Models.

tools.name: Deco
tools.one_line_profile: Dynamic Correction Decoding for Hallucination Mitigation
tools.detailed_description: A dynamic decoding strategy designed to correct and mitigate hallucinations in Multimodal Large Language Models during the generation process.

tools.name: RAP
tools.one_line_profile: Schema-aware Reference as Prompt for KG Construction
tools.detailed_description: A framework that uses schema-aware references as prompts to improve data efficiency in Knowledge Graph construction tasks.
